page.title: 16Local History
page.content: Malkins Bank was originally a series of canal locks and a row of bargees cottages built in about 1850. the middle block on the North side of the canal were originally stables. The only other development was larger houses built by Brunner Mond for factory managers in the 1900's. Malkins Bank, a close knit community, is changing to a retirement centre which could become a suburb of Sandbach. Brunner Mond, now ICI, on the South side of the canal provided work for many people in Malkins Bank and Sandbach Heath. The railway (now disused) and canal provided rapid and easy transport for the factory. A cardboard box factory- the only remaining industry-provides a few jobs.The golf course was built 8 years ago on the site of an old industrial tip, a smelly eyesore.
